required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TS-1 in Combination With Calcium Folinate in Patients With Heavily Pre-treated mCRC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study Assessing Efficacy and Safety of TS-1 in Combination With Calcium Folinate in Patients With Heavily Pre-treated Metastatic Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To determine disease control rate (DCR) of TS-1® in patients with heavily pre-treated metastatic colorectal cancer
Secondary Objectives:
- To determine objective response rate (ORR)
- To determine time to progression (TTP)
- To determine overall survival (OS)
- To assess incidence of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs) [Safety and Tolerability]

primary_outcome.description: Documented objective response (OR) (defined as partial response [PR] or complete response [CR]), assessed by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1 at any time during trial participation by Investigator assessment

secondary_outcome.description: the rate of completely response [CR] and partial response [PR] patients according to RECIST version 1.1. criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, 12 months(an expected average)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants follow-up for disease progression occur. Maximum follow-up time is 12 months after the initial administration of the last subject

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at death or at the end of study, 24 months(an expected average)
secondary_outcome.description: median time between the start date of study treatment and the date of the death

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs) [Safety and Tolerability]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of study entry until 30 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by the NCI-CTCAE (Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Effects) v4.0 and within some subgroups of patients

intervention.description: Eligible patients will receive TS-1 orally 40-60 mg (depending on patient's body surface area (BSA)) in combination with calcium folinate 30 mg twice a day for 7 days in a 2-week cycle. The treatment will be administered until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or consent withdrawal during any time of the study.

overall_official.affiliation: Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou, Taiwan
